1.q_string: A particle has initial velocity \((2 \vec{\imath}+3 \vec{\jmath})\) and acceleration \((0.3 \vec{\imath}+0.2 \vec{\jmath})\). The magnitude of velocity after 10 seconds will be:
The process of splitting a vector into two or more vectors in such a way that their combined effect is same as that of the given vector called:
A body is simultaneously given two velocities, one \(30 {~m}/{s}\) due east and other is \(40 {~m}/{s}\) due north . Find the resultant velocity.
For a projectile the angle between the velocity and the \(x\)-axis as a function of time is:
A wooden block is acted upon by two mutually perpendicular forces of magnitudes \(F_1\) and \(F_2\) on one of its corners. Which of the following is the net force acting on the wooden block?
Mohan is sitting inside a moving train. He throws a ball vertically upwards. Seema is standing on the platform watching Mohan through the train window. She will observe the motion of the ball as:
A gun fires two bullets at \(60^{\circ}\) and \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal the bullets strike at same horizontal distance. The maximum heights for the two bullets are in the ratio:

The angles of projection of three projectiles \(\mathrm{A}, \mathrm{B}\) and \(\mathrm{C}\) are \(45^{\circ}, 30^{\circ}\) and \(90^{\circ}\) respectively with the horizontal direction. Horizontal range covered by the projectiles is:
Two forces of magnitudes \(2 \mathrm{~F}\) and \(\sqrt{2} \mathrm{~F}\) act such that the resultant force is \(\sqrt{10 } \mathrm{~F}\). Then find the angle between the two forces.
What is/are the assumption(s) while studying the projectile motion?
q_option: There is almost no effect due to curvature and rotation of earth.
Acceleration due to gravity is not constant in magnitude and direction at all points of projectile motion.

1.q_string: The vector sum of three vectors \(\vec{A}, \vec{B}\) and \(\vec{C}\) is zero. If \(\hat{i}\) and \(\hat{j}\) are unit vectors in the directions of \(\vec{A}\) and \(\vec{B}\) respectively, then:
q_option: \(\vec{C}\) should be in the plane of \(\hat{i}\) and \(\hat{j}\)

1.q_string: When a motion is described as relative, what does it mean?
q_option: It means that motion is independent of the frame of reference.
It means that motion depends on the frame of reference selected.
It means that motion of any object is described relative to the motion of Earth.

1.q_string: A boat \(A\) is moving towards the north with a velocity of \(100 \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{hr}\) and boat \(B\) is moving towards the south with a velocity of \(50 \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{hr}\) such that both are moving towards each other, what will be the velocity of boat A with respect to an observer in boat \(B\)? (Consider boat is moving on still water)
Two players in a field are running with the same velocity \(v\) in the opposite direction to each other. Find the velocity of one player with respect to others.
Which one of the following is not a scalar quantity?
The basic difference between a scalar and vector is one of:
Vectors can be added by:
Magnitude of displacement of a particle is:
q_option: is equal to the path length of the particle between two points.
is less than the path length of the particle between two points.
is either less or equal to the path length of the particle between two points.
is more than the path length of the particle between two points.

1.q_string: Two forces of \( 5\) and \(10\) dynes respectively are acting on a particle, the resultant force never can be:
Upon which of the following factors the equation of trajectory of a projectile motion is not dependent?

A man throws a ball at an angle of 15 degree with a horizontal, with a velocity of 20 \(\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\). Then how far will the ball hit the ground (in meters)? (use \(\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2\) )

A projectile projected at \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal achieves a horizontal range \(\mathrm{R}\). It can achieve the same horizontal range \(\mathrm{R}\) if projected (with the same initial velocity) at which of the following angle \(\alpha\) with the vertical?
q_option: It cannot achieve the same horizontal range for any angle \(60^{\circ}\) with the vertical.

1.q_string: The ceiling of a long hall is \(25 \mathrm{~m}\) high. What is the maximum horizontal distance that a ball thrown with a speed of \(40 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\) can go without hitting the ceiling of the hall?
In a projectile motion, maximum horizontal range is obtained at the projection angle of _________ with horizontal.
Find the angle between the two vectors \(2 i+4 j-k\) and \(4 i-j+k\).
Two equal forces acting on a body in different directions have their resultant equal to the magnitude of one of the force. Find the angle between them?
Any vector in an arbitrary direction can be replaced by:
q_option: Two or three vectors perpendicular to each other and have the magnitude of resultant more than that of the original vector
Two or three vectors parallel to each other and have the magnitude of resultant equal to the original vector but direction opposite to it.
Two or three arbitrary vectors whose resultant is equal to the original vector (Both magnitude and direction)
It is impossible to replace a vector.

1.q_string: A body moves along the circumference of a circular track of radius \(\mathrm{R}\). What is the displacement of the body when it covers \(\frac{3}{4}\) the of its circumference?
If three students traveled from point A to B but took different paths, which one of the following have highest displacement?
A car moves in a circular path of radius \(30 \mathrm{~m}\) and takes \(5 \mathrm{sec}\) to reach the diametral end, then the average velocity of the car to reach the diametral end is:
